intro: Tounatea corrugata, commonly known as the wrinkled tounatea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive corrugated leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Tounatea corrugata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
